chapter.title: &C2; application suite
chapter.subtitle: Applications shipped with &C2;
chapter.para: &C2; comes with a number of supporting applications that you can use to quickly set up clustering on your own data, further tune clustering results and expose &C2; clustering as a remote service.

formalpara.title: &DCW;
formalpara.para: which is a standalone GUI application you can use to experiment with &C2; clustering on data from common search engines or your own data.

formalpara.title: &DCS;
formalpara.para: which exposes &C2; clustering as a REST service.

formalpara.title: &WA;
formalpara.para: which exposes &C2; clustering as a web application for end users.

section.title: &DCW;
section.para: &DCW; is a standalone GUI application you can use to experiment with &C2; clustering on data from common search engines or your own data.

formalpara.title: All &C2; document sources and algorithms included.
formalpara.para: &DCW; contains a large number of document sources, including major search engines, indexing engines (Lucene, Solr, Google Desktop) as well as generic XML feeds and files. It also contains all &C2;'s clustering algorithms.

formalpara.title: Live tuning of clustering algorithm attributes.
formalpara.para: &DCW; enables modifying clustering algorithm's attributes and observing the results in real time.

formalpara.title: Attractive visualizations.
formalpara.para: &DCW; comes with two visualizations of the cluster structure, one developed within the &C2; project and another one from Aduna Software.

formalpara.title: Modular architecture and extendability.
formalpara.para: &DCW; is based on Eclipse Rich Client Platform, which makes it easily extendable.

listitem.para: Quickly test &C2; clustering with your own data. Please see for instructions for the most common scenarios.
Fine tune &C2; clustering algorithms' settings to work best with your specific data.
Download and install Java Runtime Environment (version 1.5.0 or newer) if you have not done so
Download &DCW; Windows binaries or Linux binaries and extract the archive to some local disk location.

section.title: &DCS;
section.para: Document Clustering Server (DCS) exposes Carrot2 clustering as a REST service. It can cluster documents from an external source (e.g. a search engine) or documents provided directly as an XML stream and returns results in XML or JSON formats.

formalpara.title: XML and JSON response formats.
formalpara.para: &DCS; can return results both in XML and JSON formats. JSON-P (with callback) is also supported.

formalpara.title: All &C2; document sources and algorithms included.
formalpara.para: &DCS; contains a large number of document sources, including major search engines and indexing engines (Lucene, Solr). It also contains all &C2;'s clustering algorithms.

formalpara.title: PHP and C# examples included.
formalpara.para: &DCS; ships with ready-to-use examples of calling &C2; DCS services from PHP (version 5) and C#.

formalpara.title: Quick start screen.
formalpara.para: A simple quick start screen will let you make your first DCS request straight from your browser.

listitem.para: Build a high-throughput document clustering system by setting up a number of load-balanced instances of the DCS.
Download and install Java Runtime Environment (version 1.5.0 or newer) if you have not done so
Download &DCS; binaries and extract the archive to some local disk location.
Point your browser to http://localhost:8080 for further instructions
See the examples/ directory in the distribution archive for PHP, C# and Ruby code examples.

To deploy the DCS in an external servlet container, such as Apache Tomcat, use the carrot2-dcs.war file from the war/ folder of the DCS distribution.

section.title: &WA;
section.para: &WA; exposes &C2; clustering as a web application for end users. It allows users to browse clusters using a conventional tree view, but also in an attractive visualization.

formalpara.title: Two cluster views.
formalpara.para: &WA; offers two views of the clusters generated by &C2;: conventional tree view and a Flash-based visualization.

formalpara.title: All &C2; document sources and algorithms included.
formalpara.para: &WA; contains a large number of document sources, including major search engines. Optionally, further document sources can be added, such as Lucene or Solr ones. It also contains all &C2;'s clustering algorithms.

formalpara.title: XSLT and JavaScript-based presentation layer.
formalpara.para: Look & feel of the &WA; can be easily changed by editing a number of XSLT style sheets. All common style sheets and JavaScripts can be re-used when implementing a new look & feel.

formalpara.title: High-performance front-end.
formalpara.para: The front-end of the &WA; has been optimized for fast loading by using such techniques as JavaScript and CSS merging and minification, as well as using CSS sprites.

listitem.para: Make sure you have access to a Servlet API 2.4 compliant container, such as Apache Tomcat.
Deploy the WAR file to your servlet container.
